definition[0]: to state officially that a right, rule etc can be ignored
example[0]: She waived her right to a lawyer.
definition[1]: to state officially that a right, rule etc can be ignored in a particular case
example[1]: The government has waived restrictions on dealing in foreign currencies.
example[2]: American Express offered to waive fees for additional cards held by family members.
example[3]: The defendant waived his right to an attorney.
